algorithms.graph.search

Class BreadthFirstSinglePath

  • java.lang.Object
    • algorithms.graph.search.BreadthFirstSinglePath

  • public class BreadthFirstSinglePath
extends java.lang.Object
    The BreadthFirstPaths class represents a data type for finding shortest paths (number of edges) from a source vertex s (or a set of source vertices) to a singlevertex in an undirected graph.

    This implementation uses breadth-first search. The constructor takes time proportional to V + E, where V is the number of vertices and E is the number of edges. It uses extra space (not including the graph) proportional to V.

    Author:
    Wesley Leung

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      BreadthFirstSinglePath(Graph G, int s, int f)
      Computes the shortest path between the source vertex s and every other vertex in the graph G.
      BreadthFirstSinglePath(Graph G, java.lang.Iterable<java.lang.Integer> sources, int f)
      Computes the shortest path between any one of the source vertices in sources and every other vertex in graph G.
